column1: Umbu Mehang Kunda Airport (Indonesian: Bandar Udara Umbu Mehang Kunda) (IATA: WGP
column3: also formerly known as Mau Hau Airport
column5: the largest town on the island of Sumba
column6: in the province of East Nusa Tenggara in Indonesia. The Airport is inaugurated a new terminal on 2016 which is able to improve passenger services from the previous old terminal. There are some car parking lots and taxi stand outside the terminal. The Airport is managed and controlled by UPT Ditjen Hubud
column7: an agency under Ministry of Transportation
column8: Indonesia. Flight Destinations Umbu Mehang Kunda Airport is served by few local airlines daily such as Nam Air
column10: TransNusa and Wings Air with Denpasar and Kupang are the most popular routes. The Airport is capable of accommodating aircraft such as the Airbus A320
column11: Boeing 737-800 and Boeing 737-900. Airline Name Destination Nam Air Denpasar
column16: Savu TransNusa Kupang Wings Air Denpasar
column17: Kupang Public Transportation Bus: No airport bus are serving from Umbu Mehang Kunda Airport. Private cars and taxi: Various private cars and taxi services are provided by numerous individual and service providers outside the arrival hall. Bargain for the price is possible. Technical Specification The airport resides at an elevation of 33 ft (10 m) above mean sea level. It has one runway designated 15/33 with an asphalt surface measuring 2
